title-group.article-title: Techniques and Problems of Truck Exhaust System Noise Measurement

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright Â© Society of Automotive Engineers, Inc. 1978

abstract.p: Techniques and problems associated with truck exhaust system noise measurement are discussed and typical results presented. Data is presented showing the effects muffler position, exhaust pipe length, tailpipe length, source-receiver phenomena, and exhaust leaks have on radiated exhaust noise.

ref.mixed-citation: D. A. Olson, D. C. Flanders and L. J. Eriksson, "An Integrated Approach to Measurement of Exhaust and Intake Noise." Paper 760602 presented at SAE West Coast Meeting, San Francisco, August, 1976, and SAE Off-Highway Meeting, Milwaukee, September, 1976.
